commit.message:
DO NOT MERGE - broken gson class

This do not yet reproduce issue.
The visible failure during class loading is the one I see, hower the
reproducible steps are not the same.

In my original scenario, I obtain Gson class from running jvm,  jdis -g it, and
jasm it back.  It ends as here pushed GsonWeird.class , which is
malformed (without -g it works fine)

However in this test, the jdis -g of GsonOrig.class, jasm and class laod works fine (?!?).
The GsonWeird.class which fails in this tests (with both -g and without)
is the corrupted output from my original scenario.
the GsonOrig.class is the freshly obtained class from my original
scenario

added tests if asmtools assmble itself into valid bytecode

Added two set of tests
jdec->jcoder->load
jdis->jasm->load
Both in two variants, with -g, and without

Both jdec->jcoder->load works fine
Both jdis->jasm->load now fails on three files from 278:
 /org/openjdk/asmtools/jasm/JasmEnvironment$InputFile.class, /org/openjdk/asmtools/jcoder/Jcoder.class, /org/openjdk/asmtools/jasm/Parser.class
Fail looks valid.

Unluckily, the issue where -g disassembled and back assembled
com.google.gson.Gson produce invalid bytecode was not hit

The class BruteForceHelper is reusable for any set of classes
